title: Unexpected type returned from struct_tail
body:
I tried this code (I'm still learning the language, so snippet is probably nonsensical):

```
use std::iter::Peekable;

struct Foo {
    bar: i32
}

impl Foo {
    fn parse(iter: &Peekable<Iterator<Item=u8>>) {
    }
}
```

I expected to see this happen: compile to pass or to print compilation errors.

Instead, this happened:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Unexpected type returned from struct_tail: core::option::Option<<core::iter::Iterator<Item=u8> + 'static as core::iter::Iterator>::Item> for ty=core::iter::Peekable<core::iter::Iterator<Item=u8> + 'static>', ../src/librustc_trans\trans\type_of.rs:385
```

Compiler doesn't crash if offending function is placed outside `impl` block.
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.4.0 (8ab8581f6 2015-10-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 8ab8581f6921bc7a8e3fa4defffd2814372dcb15
commit-date: 2015-10-27
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.4.0
```

Backtrace:

```
   0:         0x653814fe - <unknown>
   1:         0x6537deb9 - <unknown>
   2:         0x6534571e - <unknown>

   7:         0x6bf95814 - <unknown>
   8:         0x6bfc1d77 - <unknown>
```
